title: Rektforlifeanddeath
author: Rektforlifeanddeath
content: Hello all,I have send 45 euro to my trust wallet yesterday. I have made over 31000 euro in transactions on this wallet only. Trust support is like talking to a wall only even worse. I am trying to send an amount to another wallet. It doesn't work. I always get the same error no matter how high i set the fees. The amount i am trying to send is not smaller than the fees. I can't even send 20 euro while paying 600 sats for fees. Getting sick of this. Trying to swap btc for any other coin and that is also not possible. Nothing is available. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app on Android and still the same. Anyone else with the same issues? Can't import my wallet to electrum because it doesn't recognize the 12 seed words. The adress:

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Electrum should recognize the wallet if you select -> Options -> BIP39 after typing the seed phrase.Trustwallet is slowly becoming unusable. I've been having that problem a lot lately, and the only thing I managed to do was to lower the amount when I was sending. It's probably related to the fees due to the number of transactions you might have received in the past (I'm guessing you haven't received the 31K in two or three transactions).

comments.author: Rektforlifeanddeath
comments.body: Thank you for your reply. It doesn't matter how much i lower the amount i still get the same error. The same goes with adjusting the fees higher or lower. Same problem. I don't see the BIP39 option on the mobile app. I have the option to create new wallets on electrum or import only read only modus. When i try to import the 12 frase seed it doesn't let me go to the next step in order to import the wallet.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 06:55:19 AMI don't see the BIP39 option on the mobile app. I have the option to create new wallets on electrum or import only read only modus. When i try to import the 12 frase seed it doesn't let me go to the next step in order to import the wallet. In the mobile wallet, on the page where you type your seed, there's a ComboBox to the right of "Seed type". It's set to 'Electrum' by default, tap it and change it to BIP39 and see if it works.

comments.author: Rektforlifeanddeath
comments.body: Damn that was stupid of me lol. Thanks a lot i could import it finally!

comments.author: Rektforlifeanddeath
comments.body: So i imported the seeds. It shows all transactions and balance. When i try to send anything and click on max nothing happens. As in i have no funds while there is 1.93 mbtc that should be available.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 07:11:02 AMSo i imported the seeds. It shows all transactions and balance. When i try to send anything and click on max nothing happens. As in i have no funds while there is 1.93 mbtc that should be available. That is how it is on Electrum version 4.4.0, 4.4.1 and 4.4.2. It will not show anything, just proceed to make the transaction. After you click on max, you will see the 'pay' icon at the lower right corner changed to white from no color and becomes clickable. Click on the pay icon to continue.

comments.author: Rektforlifeanddeath
comments.body: I tried this and it says insufficient funds (0). I don't know how to upload a screenshot here. Very oldschool interface with good reason I suppose. I'm just a pleb. And just now, like magic i tried the exact same thing again and it worked. Earlier it also turned to white but when i proceeded it said insufficient funds. Now it's all good. Thank you man. Really helped me.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 08:08:54 AMI tried this and it says insufficient funds (0). I don't know how to upload a screenshot here. Very oldschool interface with good reason I suppose. I'm just a pleb. To upload a picture, you can upload it to imgur, or any other image hosting provider and paste it here while including it between img tags:Code:[img]img_url.jpg[/img]Glad to hear that you sorted it out but did you manage to send the whole thing, or you had to lower it a bit?

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Good to hear that your issue is solved, but one more thing i would advice you to do is to ditch Trust wallet completely for Electrum, TW is closed source, but Electrum is an open source wallet that is recommended by most of the community. If you decide to do the right thing and start using Electrum, do not use it with a seed phrase imported from TW, like i said it is closed source and we don't know how the keys were generated, you should create a new Electrum wallet with a new seed phrase. Cheers.

comments.author: Rektforlifeanddeath
comments.body: I already deleted this trust wallet. I think I made a mistake with my last transaction tho. After a while i still had the option to cancel it so i did and the fees were deducted anyway which i understand but usually you can't cancel a bitcoin transaction? I know about double spending but that isn't the case here. I made a new transaction which i can still cancel. (Just to empty this trust wallet balance). I suppose it won't go through although block explorer says it's all good. New transaction: https://www.blockchain.com/explorer/transactions/btc/328d3229123b9b41840ee5c2d5d868b2a9f2d57ac2f92e56a06ebab83e2a08a6This is still a transaction made from electrum using the twt seed in order to empty the wallet. Funds are still funds. Will never use trust wallet after this and make several new electrum wallets. Hoping i get this sorted out first tho.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 09:43:11 AMI already deleted this trust wallet. I think I made a mistake with my last transaction tho. After a while i still had the option to cancel it so i did and the fees were deducted anyway which i understand but usually you can't cancel a bitcoin transaction? I know about double spending but that isn't the case here. I made a new transaction which i can still cancel. (Just to empty this trust wallet balance).What mistake did you think you made? You cannot cancel a BTC transaction once it has been signed and broadcasted, but you can "cancel" it through double spending if rbf is enabled, and that is what you did, you just created a new transaction with the same input to the address you want to send the funds to, usually should be done with a higher fee.Quote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 09:43:11 AMThis is still a transaction made from electrum using the twt seed in order to empty the wallet. Funds are still funds. Will never use trust wallet after this and make several new electrum wallets. Hoping i get this sorted out first tho. Your transaction would be confirmed, you just have to wait; there is no problem with it. Glad to hear you will be using Electrum wallet forthwith.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 09:43:11 AMAfter a while i still had the option to cancel it so i did and the fees were deducted anyway which i understand but usually you can't cancel a bitcoin transaction? Canceling a transaction means replacing an unconfirmed transaction with a new one paying more fee to your own address. Note that you can replace an unconfirmed transaction with a new one paying more fee, only if it has been flagged as RBF.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 09:43:11 AMThis is still a transaction made from electrum using the twt seed in order to empty the wallet. Funds are still funds. Will never use trust wallet after this and make several new electrum wallets. Hoping i get this sorted out first tho. Glad that your problem has been resolved, and sorry Trust Wallet makes things look easy for beginners, but as soon as any problems occur, the headaches are violent.Seed associated with that wallet contain serval cryptos other than Bitcoin, so if you have a balance other than Bitcoin, it may be best to check  before you decide to new wallet. It is also better to use a newly generated wallet in the future instead of the seeds that you got from the Electrum wallet.

comments.author: entebah
comments.created_time: May 11, 2023, 01:09:50 PMLast edit: May 11, 2023, 02:05:20 PM by entebah
comments.body: i saw your tx id and it seems you already doing CFPP to increase the transaction fees from the previous unconfirmed transaction by increasing it to 93.3 sat/vB.so I believe your transaction will get confirmed in a day.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: entebah on May 11, 2023, 01:09:50 PMi saw your tx id and it seems you already doing CFPP to increase the transaction fees from the previous unconfirmed transaction by increasing it to 93.3 sat/vB.so I believe your transaction will get confirmed in the next 2~5 hours. He is doing a CPFP, but according to mempool space, his effective fee rate is 25.4 sat/vByte and not 93.3 at/vByte. Transactions in the 90 sat area are getting into the next block right now, and as you can see, OP's is still unconfirmed. The 25 sat zone is still about 14 vMB away. Things are looking a bit better though.

comments.author: Rektforlifeanddeath
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on May 11, 2023, 12:52:30 PMQuote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 09:43:11 AMThis is still a transaction made from electrum using the twt seed in order to empty the wallet. Funds are still funds. Will never use trust wallet after this and make several new electrum wallets. Hoping i get this sorted out first tho. Glad that your problem has been resolved, and sorry Trust Wallet makes things look easy for beginners, but as soon as any problems occur, the headaches are violent.Seed associated with that wallet contain serval cryptos other than Bitcoin, so if you have a balance other than Bitcoin, it may be best to check  before you decide to new wallet. It is also better to use a newly generated wallet in the future instead of the seeds that you got from the Electrum wallet.Actually i have several trust wallets (and i can send larger amounts without any problems (ridiculous fees though even for higher amounts). Getting new electrum wallets with different seeds to empty those. Nog going to import them tho but just emptying them by a transaction from trust to new electrum wallets. I never keep funds long on wallets anyway. For that i use a ledger. I guess trust wallet is way more efficient using bch. But honestly this whole experience with trust wallet is just sad especially when it comes to the support. I'm guessing this whole spike in mempool is because of the new shitcoins on btc? So people willing to pay extremely high fees for small transactions? Ohh and trust wallet still has issues with the swaps even on the other wallets. So they have a rating of 4.7 in the playstore and electrum a 3.7? Lol. I have used electrum a long time ago (on desktop) and it always did what it was supposed to do however the interface was like something from 1998 and i remember some problems but none of my transactions were ever stuck or whatever (yes sometimes it did take a while but not this long). I don't even know if it's possible for a btc transaction to get stuck even when you send it with like 2 sats fees it should in theory eventually arrive correct? Good people here trying to help. I thank you all. Haven't used electrum since my desktop experience back in the day but the mobile app seems really good. I can learn a lot from this forum. Going to be a silent member untill I'm somewhat less of a pleb.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Rektforlifeanddeath on May 11, 2023, 05:54:26 PMI don't even know if it's possible for a btc transaction to get stuck even when you send it with like 2 sats fees it should in theory eventually arrive correct?The lowest fee that you can use is 1 sat/vbyte, that should be around 111 sat in fee. It depends on the mempool, if mempool is not congested at all, it will be confirmed. But mempool is congested and fee below 40 to 50 sat/vbyte may not get confirmed by this time. But the mempool congestion has reduced than before. But expect increase in fee at anytime.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: Quote from: Z-tight on May 11, 2023, 11:20:03 AMYou cannot cancel a BTC transaction once it has been signed and broadcasted, but you can "cancel" it through double spending if rbf is enabled, and that is what you did, you just created a new transaction with the same input to the address you want to send the funds to, usually should be done with a higher fee.Just a small correction. You can't cancel a transaction once it has been confirmed, you can cancel it while it's still unconfirmed (after signing and broadcasting it).When you click on "Cancel", Electrum will create a new transaction which sends all the inputs of the previous one to one of your Addresses. It's the same as "bump fees" but in this case you replace recipient address with one of yours.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on May 11, 2023, 06:17:00 PMThe lowest fee that you can use is 1 sat/vbyte, that should be around 111 sat in fee. It may worth mentioning that, currently you may not be able to broadcast a transaction with the fee rate of 1 sat/vbyte.The minimum fee rate that is accepted by a node would be higher than 1 sat/vbyte if the network is congested and mempool size of the node reaches its maximum.
